prompt:
You are a medical consultation expert.
Your task is to create NEW medical consultation Q&A pairs that follow the same format and style as the examples below.

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Generate COMPLETELY NEW scenarios (not copies of examples)
2. Match the format, style, and quality exactly as shown in the examples
3. Provide clear, detailed doctor responses
4. Cover different medical topics if possible

EXAMPLES (study the format carefully):

================================================================================
Example 1:
================================================================================
DESCRIPTION: underwent bladder surgery before 20 years but could not control urine sometimes why

PATIENT: hello doctor my brother having a problem when he was years old he underwent an operation in the bladder I have attached all the summary for your reference now he is 25 years old still he cannot control the urine for sometimes could you please suggest what we can do for this please help

DOCTOR: hi I have read through your query in detail please find my observations below your brother was treated for a tethered cord with a lipoma in close proximity to the cord at the sacral region it means that he had a fat containing tumor in the lower end of the spinal cord these are birth and developmental problems that cannot be completely treated at 25 years of age he can get another mri magnetic resonance imaging scan of lower back done and discuss it with a neurosurgeon if there is any persisting area where there is pressure on the spinal cord or the nerves usually if any pressure effect on the nerves or cord is present now then they can think of releasing the pressure and this might improve his symptoms if his condition is not possible to be treated after discussing and doing an mri scan then the only way is to pass urine at regular intervals and avoiding an over distended bladder

STATUS: medium severity

================================================================================
Example 2:
================================================================================
DESCRIPTION: what causes pain in the extracted tooth area with bone exposure that extends unto ear

PATIENT: hello doctor I had a root canal done three months ago on tooth 19 I have not had a crown done yet due to financial reasons I went to a new dentist for tooth pain in that area and he said he could not help me because the rays showed the root canal was not finished I called my endodontist back and they basically refused to see me back and said they did complete the root canal and the reason they did not fill one of the roots was for post space well my rays have been reviewed by an oral surgeon and another endodontist in the meantime who have all concluded that the root canal does not look complete as one of the roots is not filled with the filling material that is used it was also determined that tooth 18 needed a root canal but was not going to be certain to work and I may end up losing that tooth for financial reasons I opted to have tooth 18 pulled five days ago in hopes of helping the severe tooth jaw and ear pain that I am having it did not work I am still having the pain and to complicate matters I now have bone exposure on the tongue side of where my tooth was extracted I saw the surgeon yesterday and he filed it down my headaches are ridiculous and of course I worry the infection is spreading to my head I have had three recent sinus surgeries and this does not feel the same I have been on amoxicillin for over a week now but my tooth pain in 19 has increased since the extraction do you have any suggestions I am currently taking amoxicillin and norco

DOCTOR: hi I have read through your complaint and the relevant details and also saw the ray you have attached tooth number 19 seems to have a good apical seal in the root fillings the first dentist was right in saying that there is a space prepared for the post fixture there is one cusp missing in the tooth hence the treatment plan was a post and core followed by a crown the pain is definitely not because of this root canal treated tooth the reason behind this is that only poorly cleaned prepared or poorly filled roots retain the bugs to stay within the roots while deteriorating the tooth and give pain in your case the root fillings are excellent since you told you are not able to get a crown due to financial reasons at the moment the treatment plan could have been changed maybe at least the post could have been fixed leaving the crown fabrication at the last in that case at least the tooth stays stronger for a while and does not break off when you bite hard food next regarding the tooth extracted area you have mentioned that the bone is exposed now I doubt if you have got dry socket not to be mistaken for infection due to improper healing of the gums over there this might be the reason for the severe pain secondly tooth number 20 also has decay on the sides which makes me to advise you to get another ray for that tooth the current ray does not show the complete tooth this particular tooth might also be the reason for pain please do not worry that the infection spreads to the head there is no such possibility for that right now either 18 dry socket or 20 decay has to be addressed to help you get rid of the pain continue taking amoxicillin as prescribed and for pain relief you can switch to ibuprofen 400 my orally eight hourly for two days provided you do not have asthma or gastritis problems else continue narco tablet for two more days hence I advise you to visit back to the dentist and get done with further checkups as I mentioned above periapical ray for tooth number 20 to rule out interproximal cares pulpits in 20 saline irrigation and zinc oxide eugenol dressing for dry socket in 18 gargle mouth with lukewarm saltwater thrice daily for three days to flush out debris from the gums and in the extracted socket in case it not healed yet follow up after three weeks

STATUS: high severity

================================================================================
Example 3:
================================================================================
DESCRIPTION: I have a few medium sized pimples on my penis for about a few days what could it be

PATIENT: hello doctor I have a few medium sized pimples on my penis it was only one pimple a few days ago but now it has grown to four I have started drinking garlic water after watching few suggestions on youtube

DOCTOR: hi welcome to icliniq com according to your description there are multiple things that could present as such it could be molluscum contagiosum genital warts or herpes sometimes even physiologic changes such as pearly penile papeles can also present like this if you are sexually active it could be an sad sexually transmitted disease as well kindly revert to me with photos and sexual history so as to aid in diagnosis and treatment

STATUS: medium severity

================================================================================
NOW: Generate a NEW unique medical consultation scenario following the EXACT same format above:

DESCRIPTION: [brief medical question]
PATIENT: [detailed patient narrative]
DOCTOR: [clear, detailed medical advice - write naturally, don't worry about formatting]
STATUS: [low severity / medium severity / high severity]

Generate ONLY the new scenario, no meta-commentary.
api_response:
DESCRIPTION: my 3 year old daughter has been having recurrent high fevers every 3-4 weeks for past 6 months

PATIENT: hello doctor my 3 year old daughter has been having recurrent high fevers reaching 103-104 degrees fahrenheit every 3 to 4 weeks for the past six months each episode lasts about 3-5 days and she gets very lethargic with poor appetite but no other specific symptoms like cough or rash between these episodes she is completely normal and active we have visited our pediatrician multiple times who did basic blood tests that showed slightly elevated white blood cells during fever episodes but normal when she is well we are very worried about this pattern and dont know what to do next could this be something serious

DOCTOR: hi I have carefully reviewed your concern about your daughters recurrent fever pattern this pattern of periodic high fever with complete wellness between episodes is characteristic of periodic fever syndromes the most common being pfapa syndrome periodic fever aphthous stomatitis pharyngitis cervical adenitis which typically starts in early childhood however the absence of mouth ulcers sore throat or swollen neck glands in your daughters case makes me consider other possibilities like cyclic neutropenia or other autoinflammatory disorders I would recommend you maintain a detailed fever diary documenting temperature patterns associated symptoms and duration this will help tremendously in diagnosis next steps should include consultation with a pediatric rheumatologist or immunologist who specializes in such conditions specific tests like absolute neutrophil count during febrile and well periods inflammatory markers like esr and crp serial monitoring and genetic testing for periodic fever syndromes may be needed meanwhile during fever episodes ensure good hydration use acetaminophen or ibuprofen for fever control and watch for any new symptoms that may develop this condition while concerning can often be managed effectively once properly diagnosed

STATUS: medium severity
